headline.main: Lax Oversight Blamed in Demise of MF Global

docs.snippet: A House panel faulted risk oversight by some ratings agencies and MF Global's chief risk officer for the firm's demise....
docs.abstract: A House panel faulted risk oversight by some ratings agencies and MF Global's chief risk officer for the firm's demise.

byline.original: By BEN PROTESS and AZAM AHMED

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON - Congress delved deeper into the downfall of MF Global on Thursday, accusing the rating agencies and one of the firm's chief risk officers of failing to sound alarms.

headline.main: South Korean Indicted Over Twitter Posts From North Korea

headline.main: South Korean Indicted Over Twitter Posts From North Korea

docs.snippet: South Korean prosecutors indicted a social media and freedom-of-speech activist this week for reposting messages from the North Korean government's Twitter account....
docs.abstract: South Korean prosecutors indicted a social media and freedom-of-speech activist this week for reposting messages from the North Korean government's Twitter account.
docs.lead_paragraph: South Korean prosecutors indicted a social media and freedom-of-speech activist this week for reposting messages from the North Korean government's Twitter account. "This is not a national security case; it's a sad case of the South Korean authorities' complete failure to understand sarcasm," Sam Zarifi, Asia-Pacific director of the human rights group Amnesty International. Read more »

docs.snippet: Mitt Romney has revived his assertion that President Obama made the recession worse. Economists, the nonideological ones, disagree....
docs.abstract: Mitt Romney has revived his assertion that President Obama made the recession worse. Economists, the nonideological ones, disagree.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney is back to saying that President Obama "made it worse" - the recession, that is - but his charge remains factually challenged.

headline.main: Claremont's President Says Lack of Proper Controls Led to SAT Misinformation

docs.snippet: Pamela B. Gann, president of Claremont McKenna College, discusses the circumstances surrounding the submission of inaccurate SAT data and how her school can regain trust....
docs.abstract: Pamela B. Gann, president of Claremont McKenna College, discusses the circumstances surrounding the submission of inaccurate SAT data and how her school can regain trust.
docs.lead_paragraph: Claremont McKenna College gave too much authority over reporting test scores to a single individual without proper controls, the college's president, Pamela B. Gann, said Thursday in her first interview since it was revealed that Claremont McKenna had submitted manipulated SAT data to ratings agencies for six years.

docs.snippet: Companies that have settled securities fraud cases with the government are excluded from certain benefits by the Securities and Exchange Commission. But an analysis of S.E.C. documents by The New York Times found that the commission routinely waiv...
docs.lead_paragraph: Companies that have settled securities fraud cases with the government are excluded from certain benefits by the Securities and Exchange Commission. But an analysis of S.E.C. documents by The New York Times found that the commission routinely waived those exclusions for Wall Street firms. In total, the S.E.C. issued at least 344 waivers. Those shown below allowed the banks to keep their status as “well-known seasoned issuers,” and to be protected when making forward-looking statements.
